name: CreateTimeTrackingEntry
description:
Create a time tracking entry on a task.

Use this tool to log time against a specific task in Asana. It returns the information of the newly created time tracking entry, helping to keep task hours updated.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the task to operate on.

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: A list of optional property names to include in the response. This should be used to specify which additional fields you want to include in the return data format when creating a time tracking entry.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: duration_minutes_tracked
parameters.description: Time in minutes tracked by the entry. Must be greater than 0.

value_schema.description: Time in minutes tracked by the entry. Must be greater than 0

parameters.name: entry_logged_date
parameters.description: Optional. The date the time entry is logged. Defaults to today if not specified.

value_schema.description: *Optional*. The day that this entry is logged on. Defaults to today if not specified

parameters.name: project_gid_attribution
parameters.description: Optional. The GID of the project to which the tracked time is attributed. If not provided, no project attribution is made.

value_schema.description: *Optional*. The gid of the project which the time is attributable to.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true to receive formatted, human-readable JSON responses. Useful for debugging as it may slow down the response.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_pretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: opt_fields
parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: data.duration_minutes
parameters.description: Time in minutes tracked by the entry. Must be greater than 0

value_schema.description: Time in minutes tracked by the entry. Must be greater than 0

parameters.name: data.entered_on
parameters.description: *Optional*. The day that this entry is logged on. Defaults to today if not specified

value_schema.description: *Optional*. The day that this entry is logged on. Defaults to today if not specified

parameters.name: data.attributable_to
parameters.description: *Optional*. The gid of the project which the time is attributable to.

value_schema.description: *Optional*. The gid of the project which the time is attributable to.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
